com.salesforce.androidsdk.config

Class LoginServerManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.salesforce.androidsdk.config.LoginServerManager

  • public class LoginServerManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to manage login hosts (default and user entered).
    Author:
    bhariharan

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  LoginServerManager.LoginServer
      Class to encapsulate a login server name, URL, index and type (custom or not).

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCustomLoginServer(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String url)
      Adds a custom login server to the shared pref file.

      Returns a LoginServer instance from URL.
      java.util.List<LoginServerManager.LoginServer> getLoginServers()
      Returns the list of login servers.
      java.util.List<LoginServerManager.LoginServer> getLoginServersFromPreferences()
      Returns the list of all saved servers, including custom servers.
      java.util.List<LoginServerManager.LoginServer> getLoginServersFromRuntimeConfig()
      Returns the list of login servers from runtime configuration (from MDM provider), if any.

      Returns the selected login server to display.

      Removes a login server from the list.

      Clears all saved custom servers.

      Sets the currently selected login server to display.
      void useSandbox()
      Selects Sandbox as login server (used in tests).

      • getLoginServers

        public java.util.List<LoginServerManager.LoginServer> getLoginServers()
        Returns the list of login servers. Checks run time configuration first. Reads from preferences if no runtime configuration found.
        Returns:
        List of login servers.

      • getLoginServersFromRuntimeConfig

        public java.util.List<LoginServerManager.LoginServer> getLoginServersFromRuntimeConfig()
        Returns the list of login servers from runtime configuration (from MDM provider), if any.
        Returns:
        List of login servers or null.

      • getLoginServersFromPreferences

        public java.util.List<LoginServerManager.LoginServer> getLoginServersFromPreferences()
        Returns the list of all saved servers, including custom servers.
        Returns:
        List of all saved servers.
